title: Coordination Mechanisms
content: Teams coordinate through explicit mechanisms (briefings, protocols, checklists) and implicit mechanisms (shared mental models, anticipation). Effective teams use both: explicit mechanisms for clarity, implicit mechanisms for speed. Neither alone is sufficient.

mcq.question: An experienced team performs well with minimal explicit coordination. A new member joins and struggles. What's likely happening?

options.B: The team relies on implicit coordination the new member hasn't yet developed
options.D: The new member should observe and learn

mcq.explanation: Implicit coordination requires shared mental models built through experience. New members lack this. Teams should increase explicit coordination when membership changes until shared understanding develops.

openQuestions: What implicit coordination does your team rely on?
How do you help new members develop shared mental models?
